content: Quick one that needs no expertise of any kind: padic_val_nat was previously in the padic_val_rat namespace, with the sad result that it was accessed as padic_val_rat.padic_val_nat.
At a first glance it's odd to me that there's both a section and namespace named padic_val_rat and that their extents almost coincide.
It was like that when I found it, I'm afraid
I'm sure @Rob Lewis had a reason for it. There's probably a gap in my understanding of the difference between section and namespace.

It's old code from before mathlib had doc standards. All the comments were probably added later. If it looks weird and there's no note explaining why, it was probably either done for a reason that no longer exists, or not done for any reason at all.
(See the linter error in the PR now, though.)
Fixed the lint error and removed a layer of namespacing from the existing code.
